Speaker: junior stemmons

Dialogue: Yeah.

Dialogue: `US Attorney Noonan is accusing the Los Angeles Police Department in general, and Lt. David Klein in particular, of murder at worst, gross incompetence at best...'

Dialogue: -because your a thug with a law degree. Because I thought by now you'd be so indebted to this Department for not indicting and/or                   * imprisoning you, that diligent, honest discharge of duty would be assured.  And I made a horrible misjudgment.                    *

Dialogue: Bob's happy because he wants to be State Attorney General and his most likely opponent will be Welles Noonan. Tom's happy because Morton Diskant, who's leading their City Council race, is endorsed by Noonan. Thus, they're not seeing the larger play.  Noonan's new target will likely be the LAPD itself.

Speaker: bradley

Dialogue: So if the papers or Noonan come sniffing around-

Speaker: bradley
Dialogue: -we can provide adequate proof of your dismissal.

Dialogue: But you're not dismissing me.

Speaker: bradley

Speaker: me
Dialogue: You want me to torpedo Diskant so your buddy Bethune can win a City                      * Council seat uncontested-

Speaker: bradley
Dialogue: -or spend the next month in lock-up                    * before being arraigned on charges                      * of gross misconduct and dereliction                    * of duty. The preamble before you                       * face life in prison for murder.                        *

Dialogue: You've always liked your Men mean.

Dialogue: Poor you.

Speaker: me
Dialogue: Yeah, pour me...a cup please. Black, no sugar.

Dialogue: It's work.

Dialogue: More work.  Quiet while we wait for the pot...and quiet always means creeping sleep: an Enemy I never stop fighting. Force my eyes open, shift in my seat: I've been exhausted for years.  I drift despite my best efforts and for a split second you see the Hell I see when sleep wins:

Dialogue: You look like Death taking a shit.

Dialogue: He's still got that MGM-face.

Dialogue: * How's that? How many times has he           * been in here, busted you up?

Dialogue: Yeah, but he ain't got the salt             * to truly take a Man's life.                 * Especially not Hector's...he was            * scared of him.                              *

Dialogue: Tommy can't hold the throne?                          *

Dialogue: Tommy couldn't hold his pecker without Hector's help and he knows                    * that. He's gonna bury himself like                    * a tick. Good luck turning him up,                     * he took six or seven grand out the                    * safe tonight.

Dialogue: It does.

Dialogue: Something like that.                                  *

Dialogue: I'm going to work.

Speaker: me
Dialogue: You taking her?

Speaker: pete
Dialogue: I'm taking her.

Speaker: pete
Dialogue: Hughes.

Speaker: me
Dialogue: This is almost over Pete -- I'll give Milteer the five-grand back.

Speaker: pete
Dialogue: It's more than that.

Speaker: me
Dialogue: I'll square it. It's my thing.

Speaker: pete
Dialogue: That you made mine.

Speaker: me
Dialogue: I'm sorry.

Speaker: pete
Dialogue: Look as bad as I've ever seen you.

Speaker: me
Dialogue: Things are as bad as they've ever been...

Speaker: junior stemmons
Dialogue: MOTHERFUCKER -- you better meet me! That Cooze you threw everything away for is still cooked! I got the knife. I got Ainge-

Speaker: me
Dialogue: How'd you get this number Junior?

Speaker: junior stemmons
Dialogue: I got everything on you! AND I'M GONNA USE IT!

Speaker: me
Dialogue: -you're a broom-closet Queer. Your career is over.

Speaker: junior stemmons
Dialogue: The knife for MY file on Bradley. I know you already burned that Whore's but don't think I can't re- do investigations.

Speaker: me
Dialogue: You snitch to Noonan, then what?

Speaker: junior stemmons
Dialogue: Fuck Noonan. I got stronger Allies.

Speaker: me
Dialogue: Who? The Soviets?

Speaker: junior stemmons
Dialogue: Meet me in one hour with that file, Fern Dell Park-

Speaker: me
Dialogue: -Where you used to snag fruits for Vice? A volunteer gig I'm guessing.

Speaker: junior stemmons
Dialogue: Be there with Bradley's file or I scratch your scabby Bitch.

Speaker: me
Dialogue: Hey, did the Feds dig your pad?

Speaker: glenda bledsoe
Dialogue: -Dave?

Speaker: me
Dialogue: Glenda?

Speaker: glenda bledsoe
Dialogue: Sorry...you gave me this number...

Speaker: me
Dialogue: Jesus...hey...

Speaker: glenda
Dialogue: Who were you talking-

Speaker: me
Dialogue: -no, no. It's nothing. I had a phone call, just before yours.

Speaker: glenda
Dialogue: Was it him? The Cop you were telling me about?

Speaker: me
Dialogue: I don't want you to worry. I'm handling it. But I might send my friend Pete out there.

Speaker: glenda
Dialogue: You don't think it's safe?

Speaker: me
Dialogue: I'd just rather have someone there with you.

Speaker: glenda
Dialogue: I wish you would've woken me up this morning.

Speaker: me
Dialogue: I'm better-looking in low light, I didn't want to blow it for myself.

Speaker: glenda
Dialogue: I miss you.

Speaker: me
Dialogue: Where's the knife.

Speaker: me
Dialogue: Turn your lights off...and just come out and talk to me...Fritz.

Speaker: koenig
Dialogue: Not much with these sub-rosa things...

Speaker: me
Dialogue: I thought it was Noonan tailing me.

Speaker: koenig
Dialogue: Bradley's greatest stroke was enlisting you to his side.

Speaker: koenig
Dialogue: When did you know?

Speaker: me
Dialogue: I didn't. I had a feeling. I smelled cover-up all over Hector's disappearance and Wilhite wouldn't have the muscle or the mind-set to kingpin something that big by himself...you knew about Bradley trying to buy him out?

Speaker: koenig
Dialogue: He was offering to exonerate Hector and clear his criminal record. Hector met with Wilhite and I to inform us of his decision...

Speaker: koenig
Dialogue: Darktown. Chavez Ravine. Hot Spots for Human Vice. These are slums I run & profit from. If these slums suddenly become Stadiums, that profit goes elsewhere...that crime goes elsewhere.

Speaker: me
Dialogue: Bradley...you two got greed in common.

Speaker: me
Dialogue: You knew about Wilhite and Lucille. That's how you were operating him.

Speaker: koenig
Dialogue: I was aware of his sexual predilections.

Speaker: me
Dialogue: ...and someone else's...

Speaker: koenig
Dialogue: I knew young Stemmons here had a fondness for Lads, stretching back to his days at the academy.

Speaker: me
Dialogue: And now you're his only ally.  So you get this file to battle Bradley with. What's Junior get in return?

Speaker: junior stemmons
Dialogue: JUST YOU! YOU FUCK!

Speaker: koenig
Dialogue: I don't want to watch...I'm sorry it came to this, Dave.

Speaker: junior stemmons
Dialogue: I hope the Bledsoe whore was worth it...'cuz she's still fucked. For a crooked cop, you think small.

Speaker: koenig
Dialogue: This isn't it!

Speaker: koenig
Dialogue: Poorly played Dave...poorly played...

Speaker: koenig
Dialogue: Could I talk you into something? Cut you in on something?

Speaker: me
Dialogue: Won't work for me Fritz.

Speaker: koenig
Dialogue: Give me a minute then?

Speaker: koenig
Dialogue: Okay...

Speaker: bradley
Dialogue: Who?

Speaker: me
Dialogue: Fritz Koenig.

Speaker: bradley
Dialogue: Where?

Speaker: me
Dialogue: Dead. Along with Wilhite, Junior...and Hector Magdalena.

Speaker: bradley
Dialogue: Why are you here?

Speaker: me
Dialogue: To collect. I have the things you need to destroy Noonan's play. These same things can be used to destroy you.

Speaker: bradley
Dialogue: Things like?

Speaker: me
Dialogue: Stemmons files...and Wilhite's body. He committed suicide after you subpoenaed him.

Speaker: bradley
Dialogue: This body is in your possession?

Speaker: me
Dialogue: And it's what you need to burn Narco to the ground...but if those files and his body were to be given to Noonan and the Feds, with me providing the cherry-on-top testimony of a rogue cop. Well. The word `Cataclysmic' comes to mind.

Speaker: bradley
Dialogue: What will this cost?

Speaker: me
Dialogue: A percentage of your Dodger Stadium stake in perpetuity. You buy my silence for a fourth of Hurwitz Holdings.

Speaker: bradley
Dialogue: Doubtful.

Speaker: me
Dialogue: What'd you expect? A stick-up? Empty your safe? I'm about to disappear for good, and you're gonna fund my new life. You can't counter-punch out of this. Arrest me and I snitch the world.  I'm officially outta time now Chief. Call it.

Speaker: bradley
Dialogue: Wilhite's body...Bury it.

Speaker: me
Dialogue: You go to bed drunk, or just been up all night.

Speaker: klein
Dialogue: Where's Glenda, is she asle-

Speaker: milteer
Dialogue: The harder you hit him the quicker I say `stop' -- and cease that absurd crying.

Speaker: glenda bledsoe
Dialogue: THAT IMPOTENT SHIT-

Speaker: milteer
Dialogue: -touch me and he dies.

Speaker: milteer
Dialogue: You still have a job.

Speaker: pete
Dialogue: ...I'm sorry Dave...

Speaker: me
Dialogue: I put you here...that Powerhawk-

Speaker: pete
Dialogue: -there's a body in the trunk-

Speaker: me
Dialogue: -burn it.

Speaker: pete
Dialogue: I'm so sorry....

Speaker: glenda
Dialogue: Let me take you to a hospital.

Speaker: me
Dialogue: We'd never make it inside.

Speaker: glenda
Dialogue: I'm worried.

Speaker: me
Dialogue: I'm through the worst of it.

Speaker: glenda
Dialogue: I don't believe you.

Speaker: me
Dialogue: Whatever the cost.

Speaker: glenda
Dialogue: Just like that then?

Speaker: me
Dialogue: Just like that.

Speaker: pete
Dialogue: ...be nice to be in with a billionaire who's got a fleet of planes, fly you outta the country on short notice...
